Hi!

I'm Lyzi Diamond, I'm 24 years old, and I live in Portland, Oregon. I'm glad you're here.



From 8ish to 5ish, I am a GIS Technician at the Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries (DOGAMI), doing a combination of spatial analysis, Python scripting, technical writing, cartography, and web development. I like geospatial things; so much so that I also am an editor of the GIS Collective, where I blog and write tutorials along with another couple geospatial nerds. It's pretty fun.

Most of the rest of my time is spent being Program Coordinator for Code Scouts, a small, Portland-based nonprofit that helps women find their place in the digital world. I once gave a talk at PDX Git about the importance of helping beginners to get excited about coding and development using git and GitHub.

I am a member of the Oregon URISA Young Professionals, where I help organize events and run the organization's Twitter account. I also helped make the website for the group, which is also powered on GitHub pages with Jekyll. I am on the planning committee for the NW GIS User Group Conference to take place in October in Sunriver, Oregon; for the conference, I am coordinating a scholarship for young professionals and organizing volunteers.

When I'm not doing these things, i'm on my bicycle, making silly web maps, playing handbells, rowing, listening to records, writing code, making maps, watching college football, or updating this site.

On the whole, I'm just trying to get better all the time. Life's more fun that way.
